result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

**11-06-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner**
The Court ordered that the JOC in 15CF00444 shall be amended by vacating the 180 days of sentence credit.
*June 6, 2017  Initial Confinement reduced by three months.  Intial Confinement is 14 months, Extended Supervision is 16 months.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with Attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by counsel and defendant. COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

As to Count 2: 
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  2  years with  180  days credit, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  1 year

Pay costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
No contact with the victim

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
ORDER TO PRODUCE

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered count 2 amended to SUBSTANTIAL BATTERY, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.19(2) and 973.055(1), a Class I felony.
AS to amended charge:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Counts 1 and 3 are ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing on 10-7-2015.  Defendant remanded.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defense counsel is requesting a plea/sentencing date of 9-24-2015 at 8:15.  ADA Heitman to do OTP from DCI for defendant.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 10-14-2015 at 08:15 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-16-2015 at 8:15 a.m.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.

Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of today's hearing and requests adjournment for trial.
State's motion to join cases for purposes of trial, no objection by defense counsel, granted by the Court.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.

to add: COUNT #3: FALSE IMPRISONMENT, REPEATER, DOMESTIC ABUSE ASSESSMENTS, contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s); 940.30, 939.62(1)(b) and 973.055(1), a Class H Felony.   mld

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case recalled.  Jury Trial adjournment requested by the State to investigate potential telephone calls placed by defendant to the victim between the dates of 3-31-2015 and 4-24-2015., while in custody in the Waukesha County Jail.   Upon review of calls, there may be additional charges forthcoming, per the State.  For the reasons as stated on the record, The Court finds good cause to adjourn the Jury Trial and ordered case adjourned for Bail / Bond Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-13-2015 at 8:30 am.  New defense counsel will need to be appointed to case.  mld

Victim was personally served and is not present in court.  State could proceed on the charge of battery.  State advised that there will be an additional charge of false imprisonment if case proceeds to trial.  Case passed to afternoon.   mld

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Evan Glaberson for Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Daniel Stupar-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daryl A Kastenson in court, defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Based on the defendant not being produced from the Waukesha County Jail for today's proceedings and tomorrow being the 10th day, Court ordered the Preliminary Hearing adjourned to the Preliminary Hearing Court on 2-13-2015 at 8:30 am, due to the unavailability of Br. 4.  Defense moved for dismissal of case for the record.    mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Vivian W.

Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Johnny Calvin Leggett in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to count 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
